page.title: 09HOUGHTON HALL-PRESENT OWNERS
page.content: During the nineteenth century the Cholmondeleys lived at Cholmondeley castle and Houghton was not much used. In 1913,the fourth Marquess handed Houghton to his eldest son,later the fifth Marquess, on his marriage to SYBIL of the SASSOON banking family.The house was restored and treasures added from the Cholmondeley and Sassoon collections. The dowager has continued to live at Houghton since the MARQUESS' death in 1968.The present MARQUESS makes his home at CHOLMONDELEY CASTLE, but is concerned with the running of the Houghton estate and the opening of the house including the STABLES and the MODEL SOLDIERS which are his collection.He also holds the office of LORD GREAT CHAMBERLAIN to ELIZABETH 2nd. and this involves duties at the STATE OPENING of PARLIAMENT.
